item.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
item.description: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will d...

item.title: Strava Fitness App Revealed Locations of Swedish Leaders
item.description: Secret meetings and private holidays of the royal family and prime minister were inadvertently made public on Strava, which has raised security concer...

item.title: Republicans Blame Canada for Wildfire Smoke ‘Suffocating’ the U.S.
item.description: Six members of Congress from Wisconsin and Minnesota have asked Canada to say how it plans to tackle the blazes and reduce the haze billowing south.

item.title: Srebrenica, a Massacre Foretold, Still Casts Its Shadow
item.description: The town was supposed to be a “safe area,” protected by U.N. peacekeepers, but Serb forces massacred 8,000 Muslim men and boys there.

item.title: Manitoba Declares Second Wildfire Emergency in a Near-Record Year
item.description: The amount of land burned this year is on pace to be the most since 1994, as 100 blazes roared on Friday across the central Canadian province.
